activity.text:
Thanks for the clarification!

I've updated the component to use the existing translation keys in en.json by prepending resource_status__ to the status value before passing it to the t() function.

### the Implementation:
```tsx
<TableCell>
  {getStatusBadge(t(`resource_status__${request.status}`))}
</TableCell>
```

This ensures that all status values, including transfer_in_progress and transportation_to_be_arranged , are now displayed as properly translated labels instead of raw keys.

Tested and working as expected. âœ…

Tagging @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan  I believe this issue can now be assigned to me.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f1d33304-b465-49ba-beb1-77e71e87e6b1)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12519
activity.text:
THE APPROACH:

There is an inconsistency in how status values are displayed in the Resource Requests table. While the status "approved" appears correctly as "Approved", other statuses like "transfer_in_progress" and "transportation_to_be_arranged" are displayed as raw keys.

Root Cause:
These specific status keys ("transfer_in_progress", "transportation_to_be_arranged", etc.) are missing from the en.json translation file, so the t() function returns the raw key instead of a user-friendly, translated string.

ETA: TODAY

@rithviknishad
